Let’s evaluate options from our current head (7,2):

Apples and Manhattan distances:
- (6,4): |7–6|+|2–4| = 3  ← closest  
- (7,7): 5  
- (2,2): 5  
- (9,8): 8  
- (1,6): 10  

No immediate obstacles or walls in any direction. Heading for (6,4) is our shortest path: go LEFT to (6,2), then UP twice to reach (6,4) and eat that apple.

Next turn strategy: once we eat (6,4), re-evaluate the closest remaining apple and path safely around the board.

Decided next move: LEFT

1.rationale:
Analyzing the board, my snake is at (9,4) and the closest apple is at (6,4) – only three moves to the left. Moving LEFT puts me safely at (8,4), and then I can continue toward that apple without any risk of running into the enemy (which is at (7,2)) or the walls. This is a quick opportunity to grow and gain a point.

Next move: LEFT.

Next‐turn strategy: once we pick off (6,4), we’ll reassess and likely head west to (2,2) before turning for the more distant apples.  

Decided next move: UP

1.rationale:
Looking at the board, our snake’s head is now at (8,4) and the apple at (6,4) is only two moves away—first to (7,4) then onto (6,4) to consume the apple. There aren’t any obstacles in that path; the enemy snake is at (6,2) and won’t interfere with our approach. Staying on course with leftward moves is safe and the fastest way to gain the point. 

My next strategy is to move left now (heading toward (7,4)) and then, on the following turn, continue left into the apple at (6,4).

Next move: LEFT.

0.rationale:
Let’s confirm the key facts:

• Our head is at (6,3).  
• There’s an apple immediately above us at (6,4).  
• No walls or bodies block that square, and Snake #1 at (7,4) can’t reach (6,4) before us.  

Grabbing that apple costs one move (UP), nets us a point, and keeps us in open space.

Strategy going forward:  
1) After eating at (6,4), re‐evaluate. The next closest apple is at (2,2), so we’ll likely head left and then down toward (2,2).  
2) Keep an eye on enemy snakes’ positions before committing to the larger loops for the more distant apples.

Decided next move: UP

1.rationale:
Reviewing the board, our snake (ID 1) is at (7,4) and the apple at (6,4) is immediately to our left. Moving LEFT will take us right into (6,4), allowing us to eat the apple and gain a point. The enemy snake (at (6,3)) is out of our way, and there’s no danger of running into a wall or any other obstacle by moving LEFT.

Thus, the best and safest move right now is to go LEFT.

Next move: LEFT.
